column1: 0784519D-3725-4F61-8D49-E21CE290FFA8#appfire#383491FD-C5D8-40E1-8BFC-B938F4E122B2#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 08:23:27.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 08:23:27.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#6B5C58F0-3E84-4D24-B2C3-0875C291C511#appfire#383491FD-C5D8-40E1-8BFC-B938F4E122B2#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 08:23:27.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 08:23:27.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#CB4463A4-4A41-4131-A08C-0DB6B80C6A10#appfire#383491FD-C5D8-40E1-8BFC-B938F4E122B2#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 08:23:27.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 08:23:27.0#appfire#1
